intro: Geanthus polycarpus, commonly known as the many-seed geanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants like buckwheat. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Geanthus polycarpus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
